instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not seeing battery
threads.message:
Had some corrosion localized at the battery connector (J6950) <TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, replaced <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> associated corroded resistors etc and <TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR>.  Turns on but still not seeing battery.

<RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR>: 1.9K
<RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR>: 1.9k

diode mode
J6950 P4: 0.48
J6950 P5: 0.48
J6950 P6: 1.72

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>: 8.2V with or without charger

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not seeing battery
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not seeing battery
threads.message: yes I should have mentioned, already replaced with known good battery

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not seeing battery
threads.message: Check with oscilloscope if you have activity on pins 4-5 from J6950...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not seeing battery
threads.message: Crap under SMC or dead SMC/<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not seeing battery
threads.message: Reflowed the SMC, did the trick, thank you
